messages.title: Campaigning for the investments Southampton needs
messages.content: If elected I will fight for: a new NHS 'walk-in' centre east of the Itchen, a new Police Station east of the river and more police on the streets, a massive Council Home building programme for Southampton, better public transport including extra bus routes for the east of the river, an end to rough sleeping in Southampton.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A new NHS 'walk-in' centre east of the Itchen.
A new Police Station east of the river and more police on the streets.
A massive Council Home building programme for Southampton.
Better public transport including extra bus routes for the east of the river.
An end to rough sleeping in Southampton.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In 2017 he was only 31 votes behind the Tory.

housing.content: A massive Council Home building programme for Southampton.

leaflet.personalStatement: Simon and his wife Carolyn brought their children up in our city. Science teacher Simon led our City Council and served as a Councillor in Bitterne.

politicalExperience.achievements: Recognised the climate emergency back in 2017, well ahead of other councils and will push for further government action.
Brought an end to the 'bin men’s' strike in 2012, orchestrated by Royston Smith, that left one million rotting bin bags on the streets of our city. Introduced the living wage for council employees.
Led the City Deal that funded West Quay South where thousands of residents enjoy our unique city centre.

contactInformation.address: Unit 017 Solent Business Centre Millbrook Road West Southampton SO15 0HW

leaflet.additionalNotes: Letts get Simon over the line this time.
